Jinnō Shōtōki, pp. 203-204. ==Events of the Hōan era== * 1121 (Hōan 2, 5th month): The priests of Mt. Hiei set fire to Mii-dera.Titsingh, p. 181. * 25 February 1123 (Hōan 4, on the 28th day of the 1st month): In the 17th year of Emperor Toba's reign, the emperor abdicated. Toba took the title Daijō-tennō. The succession (senso) was received by a his son, Akihito.Titsingh, p.181; Brown, pp. 320-321. * 1123 (Hōan 4, 2nd month): Sutoku accepted the monarch's role and duties and powers (sokui).Titsingh, p. 182. This was confirmed in ceremonies.Varley, p. 44; a distinct act of senso is unrecognized prior to Emperor Tenji; and all sovereigns except Jitō, Yōzei, Go-Toba, and Fushimi have senso and sokui in the same year until the reign of Emperor Go-Murakami.
